005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.type;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.IItem;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.function.IMapItem;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
011
012import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
013
014/**
015 * Declares the expected type information for a {@link IMapItem}.
016 */
017public interface IMapTest extends IItemType {
018  @SuppressWarnings({ "rawtypes" })
019  @Override
020  default Class<? extends IMapItem> getItemClass() {
021    return IMapItem.class;
022  }
023
024  /**
025   * Get the expected atomic type of the map's key.
026   *
027   * @return the atomic type
028   */
029  @NonNull
030  IAtomicOrUnionType<?> getKeyType();
031
032  /**
033   * Get the sequence test to use to check the map's contents.
034   *
035   * @return the sequence type
036   */
037  @NonNull
038  ISequenceType getValueType();
039
040  @Override
041  default boolean isInstance(IItem item) {
042    boolean retval = getItemClass().isInstance(item);
043    if (retval) {
044      // this is an array
045      IMapItem<?> map = (IMapItem<?>) item;
046
047      IAtomicOrUnionType<?> keyType = getKeyType();
048      ISequenceType valueType = getValueType();
049      retval = map.entrySet().stream()
050          .allMatch(entry -> {
051            boolean result = keyType.isInstance(entry.getKey().getKey());
052            if (result) {
053              result = valueType.matches(entry.getValue().toSequence());
054            }
055            return result;
056          });
057    }
058    return retval;
059  }
060
061  @Override
062  default String toSignature() {
063    return ObjectUtils.notNull(new StringBuilder()
064        .append("map(")
065        .append(getKeyType().toSignature())
066        .append(',')
067        .append(getValueType().toSignature())
068        .append(')')
069        .toString());
070  }
071}
